summary: DOD conducted several reviews of its nuclear forces in 2014-2015, leading to hundreds of recommendations to improve leadership, morale, and more. We found that DOD has made headway implementing recommended changes. However, some of its measures of progress need reassessment. For example, we found that a measure of the work environment—its command climate survey—contained unreliable data. Additionally, DOD created a new nuclear oversight organization but...
title: Defense Nuclear Enterprise: DOD Can Improve Processes for Monitoring Long-Standing Issues
